website_summaries.verdict: Smell and taste appeal to most cats, while the effectiveness appeals to their owners.
pros: Appealing tuna flavor, cats will think it’s a treat
Easy to apply safely and smoothly to nose or paws
cons: Tube should be stored upside down to avoid leakage

customer_reviews.title: 90% Reduction in Cat Barf**
customer_reviews.text: Fatty McFatcat will eat anything, and he loves to lick this right off my finger. Snooty McBratcat, who dislikes almost everything, does not want me to know she enjoys it, so I have to smear it on her paws and let her lick it off in private. I am finding approximately 90% less cat barf and hairballs** in my house since I started to give this to them on a regular basis, so I'd have to say it works pretty well. **This is an estimate and no actual scientific experiments were conducted
customer_reviews.author: Jammer

customer_reviews.title: Cat spazzed out at first, then grew to love it.
customer_reviews.text: My long haired cat stopped eating and was getting really thin. After worming didn't help, I got this gel and put some on her foot, at which point she went totally ballistic. The next morning there was a massive log of a hairball in front of the bathroom....it was totally gross, but my cat was eating again, thank God! Now if i just put some on my finger, she will lick it straight off. I also got a furminator comb, which she had to bite a bunch of times before she would let me comb her. I was shocked how much hair she was ingesting by self grooming. Get one of those to go along with this.
customer_reviews.author: Puwdy pad

customer_reviews.title: but my cat hated it. I bought the Catnip flavor and she ...
customer_reviews.text: This stuff is life changing. I have a cat that over grooms and throws up every time she eats. Never throws up hairballs though. I changed her cat food and put her on prescription cat food. No change. Read the reviews and this and thought I would give it a shot. I had Maple flavored stuff the vet gave me, but my cat hated it. I bought the Catnip flavor and she loves it. Licks it right out of the tube every morning and has only thrown up once in 3 weeks. Pretty sure this just saved my marriage and/or my cats life.
customer_reviews.author: Jane Doe

customer_reviews.title: Not Catnippy Enough For My Cat; How I Got Her to Eat It
customer_reviews.text: This works so well for my cat, who has been constipated with stools that are loaded with hair. I was even able to discontinue her daily laxatives and now use Laxatone only. Although she loves catnip, apparently this isn't catnippy enough for her. She won't lick it off my finger, and I have to smear it on her paw instead, which she doesn't really like (although it's much less stressful than syringing her with the liquid laxative). But I put a little in a bowl and sprayed it with catnip spray, and she ate that right up. But it does work very well. I will buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: Marie McCTop Contributor: Quilting

customer_reviews.title: It works, thank God
customer_reviews.text: I've taken in both of my mother's fluffy cats, since she can't take care of them anymore. They have always hacked up hairballs, so I started treating them with Tomlyn hairball remedy. At first I had to smear it on their paws, which is something of an ordeal for everyone, but all that vomiting is extremely harmful, so I did it anyway. After a couple of weeks, they developed a taste for it and will now lick 2-5 pea-sized blobs from my finger. I give it several times a week. So glad they are taking it willingly. No more hairballs at all.
customer_reviews.author: Dragon Serving Tea

customer_reviews.title: Product has changed.
customer_reviews.text: I have always got this brand. Not sure what's happened lately but it is not the same consistency. It used to be a bit thicker. Now it is really runny and you can't even keep it on your finger long enough to get it to the cat's mouth. It's so runny it also runs out of the tube and fills up the lid it you keep it upright. Sad that I need to find something else now.
customer_reviews.author: Dawny

customer_reviews.title: Pukey McGee had his vomit super power taken away!
customer_reviews.text: This stuff is really annoying to use but it does the trick for keeping my cat from hacking up hairballs on my bed, floors, couch, and pool table. The little brat would just go around barfing everywhere and no one likes to clean up cat puke 6x a day! This stuff just basically lubes up their insides so the hairball will pass through the digestive system and it works. I was suggested to use this by my vet and I am very happy amazon stocks it so I can just have it shipped to my door. No special trips to the vet to pick up more!
customer_reviews.author: Nicole H

customer_reviews.title: Ok I should have heeded the comments about the Tuna ...
customer_reviews.text: Ok I should have heeded the comments about the Tuna flavor. I bought the Tuna because my cat is crazy about tuna and could care less about chicken. Well, she wasn't too excited about this tuna. I'll try another flavor next time. It does help with her hairball which we are all so grateful for. I gave it a 3 star because I have to trick or hide the flavor in her wet food. This product does work however.
customer_reviews.author: Deedle

customer_reviews.title: Only one of my cats like this, because the rest are stubborn jerks
customer_reviews.text: Only one of my cats like this, because the rest are stubborn jerks. But that is not the fault of the product, its the cats. I put it on the paw of one of my older cats thinking she would have to lick it off, but instead she walked around her collected dirt and dust and got the gel everywhere. But the cat that does like it, would eat it all day everyday if he could.
customer_reviews.author: KG

customer_reviews.title: Caused My Cat to Get Sick and Constipated
customer_reviews.text: The first time I bought this, it seemed to help my cat. The second time, though, it had a different consistency, and it made my elderly cat really sick. She became constipated and could only pass the Laxatone (which, sorry to be gross, came out with almost the same texture/thickness that it had when she ate it). She was miserable for days. Fortunately, olive oil relieved her constipation, and she's back to normal now. No more Laxatone for us because this product is inconsistent.
customer_reviews.author: Horror_Lover

customer_reviews.title: but I'm not sure how good it's working for them
customer_reviews.text: Two out of my four cats will eat this, but I'm not sure how good it's working for them. I had all four of them on this for about three months with two of my cats getting it almost everyday (based on vet recommendations). The two still have very bad coughing and wheezing. I switched to a different laxative just a couple weeks ago and am also buying a food specifically for hairballs, and already I'm seeing better results. This just didn't help my cats very much, but the two who liked it did enjoy it as a treat and none of them had any bad side effects from it.
customer_reviews.author: SaraTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Effective, but cat hates it
customer_reviews.text: This product worked GREAT for preventing and reducing our long-hair cat's hairball issues. However, she HATES the smell of this product, so getting her to eat it requires either 1) sneakily mixing it into her wet food or 2) smearing a tiny bit on her paw for her to groom off. If you have a not-high-maintenance cat or you are willing to do some work to coax them to consume the product, it works great! Otherwise, I would recommend being willing to pay a bit extra and checking out the Feline Greenies hairball control treats. My picky cat LOVES those treats, and they also helped manage her hairballs, while not being as cheap as this option. Less misery for everyone.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not the miracle I was hoping for, but helps
customer_reviews.text: My cat has been getting less hair balls, but he still gets them, and my white carpet still needs to be commercially cleaned, albeit less regularly. I loathe that the instructions say to put this on your cat's paw. How cruel. Cats are animals that love to be clean, my cat was terrified when I put this on his paw. I now add a drop to his food. Finally, the stuff is like molasses, very sticky. Be prepared for it to get all over the bottle and almost everything else until you get used to handling it.
customer_reviews.author: Jen's Husband

customer_reviews.title: My cat loves it!
customer_reviews.text: My cat loves this stuff!! I've given him Laxatone in the past, and it's always a fight to get it down him (he's 16 years old and having some health problems). But this Tuna flavored gel is different, he will lick right it off my finger - he loves the taste. He seems like he's feeling better now after taking it for the last 4 or 5 days.
customer_reviews.author: mt2hi

customer_reviews.title: Works really well. Cat hasn't thrown up since I ...
customer_reviews.text: Works really well. Cat hasn't thrown up since I started using this. As other reviewers mentioned, it's runnier in consistency than some brands. But I prefer that because the cat doesn't flick it off her leg. I squeeze a strip on my finger, let it melt for a few seconds, then wipe it on her in a long stroke down her leg. It goes on in a thin layer which she has to lick off, rather than just flicking.
customer_reviews.author: M.A.B.

customer_reviews.title: Cats favorite treat.
customer_reviews.text: I have been trying for many years to find a hair ball remedy that my cat will eat more than once or twice. I struck gold with this product. I can't tell you if it really tastes like catnip but i can tell you she goes crazy for it. Just has to see the tube and she is at my feet meowing. She has always had a ton of hairballs and when I am good and give her this consistently she does get fewer.
customer_reviews.author: v

customer_reviews.title: Works, but it's mostly sugar
customer_reviews.text: Pros: My cat loves it She hasn't had a hairball since I started giving it to her Cons: It contains three different sugars: molasses, corn syrup, malt syrup My other cat doesn't like the taste - not a problem, since she doesn't get hair balls, but the flavor seems hit or miss In summary, I would keep using it, but I don't want to destroy my cat's otherwise-good teeth. In the words of the vet, she's a 5-year-old cat with the teeth of a 1.5-year-old cat. Tomlyn makes a chicken flavor laxatone with no sugar, so I'll be giving that one a try.
customer_reviews.author: CBA

customer_reviews.title: Well finicky cat is still finicky
customer_reviews.text: Have tried other products but my cat refused to taste. So since this one said tuna flavored which she likes-(not loves); I was hoping she would take this one easier. She is still being finicky and still have to fight her to take this. However, that being said I have being giving her a tiny amount a couple of times a day( since she gets angry trying to give her a full dose at one time). Using this at the recommendation of my vet to help soften her stools and I can say it has helped. The problems I have are because of my cat.
customer_reviews.author: jules

customer_reviews.title: Not 1 in 12 cats would touch
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately not one of my six cats or four fosters (not any out of 10-12) would touch the stuff. They all hated it. Even when I put their favorite treats in the gel, they wouldn’t eat it and they ignored the treats with even a smudge of it. I missed the return window because I tried waited and tried it with the next two foster cats. Now I’m left with a gross messy tube I have to throw away. I wish I remembered the brand they used to like.
customer_reviews.author: Julie A. M. Tsohandaridis

customer_reviews.title: I think it's working....
customer_reviews.text: My cat has medium length fur, but he has a BAD hairball situation because he is always grooming. I think Laxatone is working, but he's also wearing a cone right now, which has reduced his grooming considerably. A big negative is that it is very hard to administer. He won't lick it off his paw-when I tried that it was a BIG MESS. I tried swiping into his mouth with my thumb- that was also was messy. I have only found success when hiding it under a wet treat. I know you aren't supposed to give it with food, but I'm out of options. I love the stuff if it works, so far it seems to be
customer_reviews.author: Zora Y

customer_reviews.title: No Change
customer_reviews.text: I was recommended this by a friend, because I complained about my cat throwing up after eating usually. She has a dense coat, and we thought it was hairballs causing it to be more frequent. She didn't like licking it when I put it on her nose, had to sneak it on her food. I really didn't notice a different after using it for a month. And it didn't seem worth the effort of forcing her to take it when it wasn't helping. Really is dependent on the cat; might work for yours... didn't work for mine. And now I just have a bottle of this stuff sitting around.
customer_reviews.author: Serafina

customer_reviews.title: Keeps the stressed induced hairballs at bay!
customer_reviews.text: This stuff is works great and far cheaper than the brand my vet hocks. Works like a charm and its palpable enough that my picky boy doesn't fight too much when I smear it on his paw. I don't really understand why it has so much sugar though. Cat's don't have those kind of tastebuds, but at least the cat nip flavor doesn't reek of sugary sweetness like the maple flavor does.
customer_reviews.author: Judy Steger

customer_reviews.title: This flavor is unpalatable
customer_reviews.text: My cats didn't like the taste of catnip flavored laxatone. I had to smear it on top of their paws so they would lick it off, which caused then to get some of it on furniture. I tried to use it when one of my cats was showing signs of mild constipation (spending more time in the litter box and straining). Not sure it this helped, since I only used it once before I switched to using a different, chicken flavored, laxative.
customer_reviews.author: FoxySonia

customer_reviews.title: Messy but it works
customer_reviews.text: Like Nutri-Cal, this stuff is runny and messy as heck, but it’s quite effective. My nearly 14 yr old cat has been having a lot of trouble eating and passing stool, and we’ve also suspected a hairball impaction of some sort as the main culprit behind his illness. After a good dose of this gel, he was able to poop normally like he hasn’t done in weeks. His meow is also clearer and less hoarse.
customer_reviews.author: Sleeps in Rain

customer_reviews.title: I have used this for years
customer_reviews.text: I have cats. I have had cats for many years. All cats need a bit of help with hair passing through their system from time to time. This seems to do the trick, gets the hair out and in my opinion helps keep my cats in good shape. None of them like it. They don't just lick it off my finger. I have to smear it on a paw and then they feel compelled to clean it off. So, I can't say that they find it tasty, but I do get it into them.
customer_reviews.author: Solana

customer_reviews.title: ... the other reviews that I would have the same good luck with my two cats
customer_reviews.text: I was hoping when I read the other reviews that I would have the same good luck with my two cats. My cats LOVE it!!! We have made it a treat for them... a tap the spoon on the lid and they come running and like it off the spoon enjoying it every time. I used to use my finger, but they like the small spoon much better. I highly recommend this product and I'm definitely going to be buying this catnip flavor again. Thank you Tomlyn!!!
customer_reviews.author: Pierre Silva

customer_reviews.title: For my rabbits
customer_reviews.text: I keep this around the house for one of my rabbits who is particularly prone to getting a little blocked up. With rabbits it's important to 1) Talk to a vet before using this product and 2) Make sure they're HYDRATED before using. Seriously - if they're dehydrated and you use this product, it could actually make the problem worse. At the vet, this exact same product costs twice as much, so it's nice to be able to get it cheaper on Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Alyssa

customer_reviews.title: Not just for hairballs
customer_reviews.text: Purchased at my vet's office after my cat suffered a fractured tailbone. Because of this suggestion from the vet our cat does not seem to be experiencing any more discomfort when trying to have a bowel movement. Although this is a hairball remedy my vet explained that so long as one of the main ingredients is mineral oil, if your cat is suffering from and injury in that region of her body it helps to coat the intestinal walls and kind of helps more easily slide everything out of there with the least amount of discomfort for your cat. Love this product and so does Sweetie Pie! She seems to care most for the catnip flavor.
customer_reviews.author: Victoria

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: Great price and my cats haven't said anything negative. Tomlyn Hairball Remedy works really well and very fast, too! By the way, has anybody out there ever tried administering the gel orally? Do you think the cat would swallow it? Seems like it might work well if I fed it to both of them? Think I'll give it a try.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. X

customer_reviews.title: I tried mixing a small amount into a serving of her favorite wet food but she seemed not too pleased after ...
customer_reviews.text: My cat is not a fan of the taste/smell of this product and after licking a small amount off of my finger the first time it was offered she refused to eat any more. I tried mixing a small amount into a serving of her favorite wet food but she seemed not too pleased after tasting the mixture. Though, to be fair she is VERY picky. Personally, I have had much more success with offering a small amount of olive oil for her to lick off of my fingers. However, I do not think this is necessarily an issue with the product itself.
customer_reviews.author: Cassandra Hart

customer_reviews.title: Not as effective as big name brand in our fur family.
customer_reviews.text: Long term issue with one of my cats has been handled by multiple dosages every week for the life of our fur baby. I switched to this product to try to improve my cat's situation and change the ingredients going into his system... The furballs and constipation returned quickly. My poor guy is back on the big brand products and I wasted money. Small consolation, he likes the flavor.
customer_reviews.author: WeInSC

customer_reviews.title: It probably does what its supposed to
customer_reviews.text: I had just recently gotten my cat and he coughed up a hairball. Since I'd never seen one before I was terrified and started looking at ways to solve the problem. I only used it once but haven't used it since mostly because my kitty isn't coughing up hairballs anymore. He gud.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: My Cat Hates This
customer_reviews.text: My cat will not go near this stuff. After she ignored a bit on a plate, I put a tiny bit near her mouth/nose and she ran to her favorite vomit spot. I smelled the gel, and it just smelled like soy sauce, not tuna, to me. For the record, she will not eat Petromalt either which both of my previous cats loved. She does like the Pet Naturals Hairball treat.
customer_reviews.author: MBmb

customer_reviews.title: My kitties go nuts for this stuff!
customer_reviews.text: I was leery at first because of the flavor being catnip, I wasn't sure if my cats would like it. I can tell you that the fears were definitely misplaced. They beg for this every night, and it works great. I have noticed that with regular use they never have hair ball issues, they seem to get them back if they go for a week or more without this, I have three kitties so I make sure to buy two at a time instead of one now, so I never run out.
customer_reviews.author: R. A. BlackTop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: My cat loves how this taste!!
customer_reviews.text: Cat absolutely loves how this taste!! My vet recommended this product to me to help reduce hairballs. Since it is currently winter and my cat is not shedding as much I haven't yet seen the results. But the fact that my cat just loves to eat this makes me want to repurchase again and again. If I ask her "you want some goop?" She gets excited and licks it right from the bottle. So no mess for me! Based on reviews and my veterinarian's recommendation I believe that this will also help her pass her hairballs more easily and barf less often.
customer_reviews.author: Cyn B.

customer_reviews.title: It seens to be helping
customer_reviews.text: I put the ointment on her paw the first three times she ran then licked it off. Coughing seemed less. I finally just squeezed some onto her dish and dhe licked it. It serms dhe is having less problems with hairballs but it hasn’t stopped entirely. I only do this 3 days a week folliwing instructions. Am tempted to use everyday but my sis said no it will give ger diarrhea
customer_reviews.author: DonnaRn

customer_reviews.title: Failed the Kitty Test in this house.
customer_reviews.text: Kittydoes not like. None of the cats like. Sorry we had high hopes..don't we always with our pets. For price they need to develop a product that kits really do like. And you can get it down them. Our cat just peeled it off the paw when we tried that..left it on a comforter that when we found it had veneered and dried out and was difficult to remove. So may work for your kitties but not our babies.
customer_reviews.author: Lincoln County MT

customer_reviews.title: My cat is a little picky when it comes to ...
customer_reviews.text: My cat is a little picky when it comes to flavors, but she loves this stuff! She rarely has issues with throwing up hairballs, but she does have issues sometimes from her other end.. Her fur passes, but often has trouble properly expelling it cleanly, if you get my drift.. I've been giving this to her on and off for a few years now and the issue is now gone!
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Eh. It was ok.
customer_reviews.text: I tried to put this on my cats paw and he freaked out (not the products fault) so I tried mixing it in his food and he will eat it without an issue. After using the whole bottle his coat is nice and shiny but the hairballs and still a constant. I brush him twice a day and he's a domestic shorthair. I'm still going to use this until I can think of something out.
customer_reviews.author: Nikki

customer_reviews.title: Great for Hairball Control
customer_reviews.text: This works great for our long haired cats and keeping their hair balls under control. No more hairy barf balls through the house. The maple flavor must be good because four out of five of our cats will just eat it right off my finger.
customer_reviews.author: Tanya ATop Contributor: Star Wars

customer_reviews.title: Moldy cap within 3 weeks of opening
customer_reviews.text: I'm torn on how to review this product. Our kitty really enjoyed the flavor, and it seemed to be helping with her hairballs. However, after only 3 weeks the inside of the cap and threads were covered in a black mold/mildew, and I threw the entire tube out. There are no instructions to store this in the refrigerator, so we kept it on the counter. I'm pretty disappointed that we had to waste 95% of the tube because it spoiled so quickly.
customer_reviews.author: E. Kramer

customer_reviews.title: Cats hated it
customer_reviews.text: I’m not sure what other people are talking about but both of my cats wouldn’t even attempt to eat this. They ran away, I even put it on treats and the still wouldn’t touch it. My cats are not picky either, they eat almost anything. I guess I should stick to olive oil.
customer_reviews.author: EB

customer_reviews.title: Was never received
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product for cats with hairballs, I give it to my Lucy LuLu everyday in small amounts so while I was visiting my daughter in NC I noticed Ruthie was having the same issue. I ordered some to have it sent to her, unfortunately she hasn’t been able to reap the benefits because she didn’t receive this amazing product. I highly recommend this product and give it 5 Stars hands down
customer_reviews.author: stephanie

customer_reviews.title: Love this stuff - makes a big difference
customer_reviews.text: Our cat used to throw up hairballs at least several times a week- we're in a hot climate and she's constantly grooming. It was really tough on her system, her teeth, etc. Brought her to the vet for testing to make sure it wasn't medical related....after checking her out, vet recommended this - can't speak for other pet owners, but I definitely noticed a big difference.
customer_reviews.author: HS

customer_reviews.title: Check the price per ounce!!
customer_reviews.text: This formula works well for my cat who has a chronic hairball issue. I put some on a plate and she eats it right away. However, I made the mistake of not checking the size of the tube before ordering from this vendor. I usually get 8oz for $8.99. In this case, I got 2.5 ounces for $8.99 which is a rip-off. It’s my own fault since I didn’t realize the size difference when I placed the order - lesson learned.
customer_reviews.author: Laurett E. Gannon

customer_reviews.title: Works on Finicky Cats
customer_reviews.text: We like this fur ball remedy because we have two cats who groom a lot but are also very finicky. We like that is is supposed to be healthier than some other choices. We smear the recommended amount on their front paws and then let them groom it off! They do not run when they see the tube so it must be an acceptable taste and experience!
customer_reviews.author: MaryMerry

customer_reviews.title: JUST LIKE SOUP
customer_reviews.text: WAY TOO LOOSE.......ITS WAY TOO RUNNY......HORRIBLE PRODUCT.........AS SOON AS YOU OPEN IT IT STARTS OOZING OUT ALL OVER THE PLACE.....YOU TRY TO PUT SOME ON YOUR FINGER TO GIVE TO CAT AND BAM ITS ALL OVER THE FLOOR......VERY POOR PRODUCT.......I WILL KEEP LOOKING FOR A DECENT PRODUCT.........THIS IS NOT IT.........VERY SLOPPY TO USE....I DO NOT RECOMMEND
customer_reviews.author: michaelo

customer_reviews.title: Yes, This is the Stuff You Should Get.
customer_reviews.text: My 15 year old has struggled with hair balls for years. After trying special foods and getting meds from the vet that didn't work for long, I decided to give this a try. I am so glad I did. I followed the directions perfectly and it's been about two months since my boy has had a hairball-hacking-attack. It's legit.
customer_reviews.author: john

customer_reviews.title: Ok
customer_reviews.text: I tried several times to get my cats to use this, but they refused. I think it's the smell because they both recoiled and made that "what the heck" face when they sniffed it. It is a sticky, gooey mess when they flip it off their paws. One of the cats even rubbed it onto the couch cushion! Probably would have been much better without a scent or flavoring.
customer_reviews.author: K S

customer_reviews.title: Works well but messy
customer_reviews.text: The actual product works well. My cat does not get hairballs when I use this regularly. The reason I give 3 stars is the packaging always makes this leak! I'd love if this came in a pump or a dropper or something that didn't make a huge mess.
customer_reviews.author: Brittany G.

customer_reviews.title: My cats love tuna cat food
customer_reviews.text: My cats love tuna cat food, but won't go near this stuff. It's no better than unflavored or any other kind of hairball gel - you just have to put it on a nose or paw and hope they lick more off than they smear on to your furniture. As far as efficacy, after the drama of getting it into them, it does its job decently, but again, no better than any other formulation, and not as well as some of the more high-end brands.
customer_reviews.author: Laura6872

customer_reviews.title: Not as yummy for my cats as I had hoped
customer_reviews.text: Well, I guessed that my cats would love the catnip flavor. One takes the maple flavor if I put it in her food. The other won’t go near the maple flavor no matter what. unfortunately neither of them had any interest in this catnip flavor version - no matter what I did or where I put it. Which is not to say that nine out of 10 other cats won’t think it’s terrific.
customer_reviews.author: CathieQ

customer_reviews.title: Our cat loves this stuff!
customer_reviews.text: Our cat has a hairball problem AND constipation. He's old (18), currently recovering from injury, so his system is all upset. I put a bit of this on my fingertips and he laps at it like crazy. It seems to really help him in the litter box department, so we're very happy. And our hairball issues seems better, too. All around great, since it score both with us AND with the cat.
customer_reviews.author: Quirkywriter

customer_reviews.title: CAAAAAT GAAAAAK PREVENTION?
customer_reviews.text: Five stars for flavor and thickness. Yum yum. Soooo dee-licious. 1-star for "cleaning up hair." Seriously? What kind of star rating is that? NO ONE in this house cleans up cat hair except me. That being said, I would rather clean up cat hair and hairball gut gak than touch DH's dirty skivvies. >^..^<
customer_reviews.author: HitesMites

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work for us
customer_reviews.text: My cat hated this (catnip flavor). I tried smearing it on her for a few days and she would eventually get it licked off (and hopefully not rubbed on any furniture or carpet). I stopped using it after she got the runs and I had to spend a fair amount of time washing poo out of her backend fur (she's got long fluffy hair). I did not notice if it helped with the hair ball situation or not because I gave up after a week of use.
customer_reviews.author: PrimeShopper

customer_reviews.title: My cat is absolutely ADDICTED to this stuff! Any ...
customer_reviews.text: My cat is absolutely ADDICTED to this stuff! Any time I go into the kitchen he follows me, begs, and jumps up on my legs. He's never done that before, not even for his beloved string cheese. It also *really* helps with the hairballs. Although he's short-haired, he grooms himself constantly and used to throw up multiple times a day. Now he rarely does and it's such a blessing.
customer_reviews.author: chelsea d.

customer_reviews.title: It Works!
customer_reviews.text: Not sure I should be commenting on the flavor as I have never personally tasted it. But my picky cat, who rejected all the fish and malt varieties, loves this stuff. Who knew cats like maple? And it works. She’s a compulsive groomer, swallows a lot of fur during shedding season. Instead of vomiting, she would have terrible coughing and hacking spells of dry heaves. Not any more. A half inch of gel every other day, served in on her own little spoon, keeps everyone happy.
customer_reviews.author: Mary T.

customer_reviews.title: My cat actually likes the taste of this!!
customer_reviews.text: My vet recommended this product but did not have the catnip flavor. I found it here and he absolutely loves the taste so getting him to take it straight from the tube works very well. He also likes the malt flavor of the nutritional high calorie gel from this same company. And he is a fussy cat so I'm very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: HappyinColo

customer_reviews.title: It's okay.
customer_reviews.text: My cat did not like the flavor at all, so I had to put some on my finger and put it in his mouth. I hated doing so, as I know he didn't understand why I was forcing him to eat this nasty tasting stuff. I gave up using it because of the above, so I don't know if it would have worked. The two times I did use it caused him to have very loose movements, which I know often happens.
customer_reviews.author: Gabe

customer_reviews.title: Don't, save your cat some discomfort.
customer_reviews.text: My cat loved the smell and tried it....but ended up barfing 5 times, almost took him to the vet it was so bad. I can't possibly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Skeletonkey IFOR

customer_reviews.title: My cats liked the flavor
customer_reviews.text: My Cats really liked the maple flavor as long as I did not try to give them too much. The product is a fair amount runnier \ thinner viscosity than others I've tried. I feed them by squeezing a little on my finger and letting them lick it off. If they were not quick enough it would start to run off and drip onto the floor.
customer_reviews.author: NBSTL68

customer_reviews.title: She has hairballs really bad. When I put this on her food she ...
customer_reviews.text: This was for an outdoor kitty that I feed. She has hairballs really bad. When I put this on her food she refused to eat. I tried putting on her foot so she would lick it off. She was so mad I didn't see her for 2 days. I gave up.
customer_reviews.author: cathy gatewood

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful
customer_reviews.text: My cat loves this stuff, I just put the directed dose on the rim of his bowl and he licks it right up. Every time he sees the bottle he starts meowing with excitement. I even use it as a treat after bath or claw trim, only in tiny amounts though cause we sate in the suggested routine printed on the bottle.
customer_reviews.author: Caroline

customer_reviews.title: Cat loves it!
customer_reviews.text: Our cat loves it and runs to it just like any other treat. Before buying this product I had noticed that he was making all of the sounds of a hairball but nothing would come up. I then thought that maybe he was sick but tried this product first (due to the sound of it being a hairball like action). Within a few times of using it he no longer struggled and has stopped.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda M.

customer_reviews.title: Cat hates taste - owner loves results
customer_reviews.text: cat HATES it but she doesn't get to review it. She won't eat it unless smeared on paw - but it does work and is thick enough to not drool too far off paw. When it did, it cleaned easily. Can't blame them for my finicky cat. But can thank them for no more hacking and huffing.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas E. Stazer

customer_reviews.title: Kitties like it
customer_reviews.text: Was having an unusually barfy season, so decided to give this a try. So far,so good. I keep it in the fridge as l live in a hot climate. It would get too runny otherwise and difficult to administer from my fingertip. Yes, l do have a.c..
customer_reviews.author: j.

customer_reviews.title: Love the simple package !  Works good
customer_reviews.text: Just like the original, now package looks nice and simple which I like. One cat licks it off my finger as usual, the other I have to smudge it on her side and they have to lick it off. NEVER ON THE PAW! they just fling it all over. :) I will update to 5 stars after a few weeks of using this to make sure it is working for the hair balls. Will buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Linda

customer_reviews.title: Good for hair balls & constipation
customer_reviews.text: It does help with the hair balls and occasional constipation. Only problem is that it comes out a bit runny. Another brand I used was too difficult to squeeze out of the tube, but this brand comes out too easily & can make a mess if I am not careful. I was trying to hold my cat and apply this to his fur to lick off, and ended up spilling a lot of it.
customer_reviews.author: ee

customer_reviews.title: Wrong product arrived but cats like them all
customer_reviews.text: Would have given 5 stars since my cats love this and it’s the only product I’ve found that my older cat regards as a real treat after he gets meds, nails clipped, etc...but this time I received 2 tubes of the high nutrient gel for puppies rather than the hairball gel for cats. My cat didn’t seem to know the difference, however, so for my purpose still works well and not worth the haste of returning for the cat version.
customer_reviews.author: devil monkey

customer_reviews.title: I would recommend feeding it to your cat either on a spoon ...
customer_reviews.text: This gel works very well and my cat loves to eat it. She hasn't had a hairball since I've started giving it to her, and it hasn't created any unsavory litterbox situations, either. Word of advice: I would recommend feeding it to your cat either on a spoon or in a dish, as it's very sticky and will be really a pain if it gets on things because cleanup is very difficult.
customer_reviews.author: Anna S

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: My poor little girl has so many hairball problems - long fine hair- lots of it. I give her this every few days and it works great. I bought the salmon and maple flavor because I wanted to give her options. She has been given the maple flavor before and it worked well. So far so good!
customer_reviews.author: Kristi W Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Does it’s Job
customer_reviews.text: Repeat buyer. Less expensive then buying at the vet. Put on my kittys nose she licks it off. Thrn I wipe her nose face off with a wet/ damp paper towel. My cat is a long haired Maine coon breed. So she’s gets hair balls. Basically it’s flavored Petroleum jelly, I think
customer_reviews.author: Frank NYC

customer_reviews.title: My cat refuses
customer_reviews.text: My cat doesn't like the scent. She won't eat this. I've tried multiple ways to introduce this into her diet and she wont' have it. She doesn't have many hairballs but it sounds so painful when she does. I wanted this to work. Hiding it in liquids or solids doesn't work. I've tried for months and I can't. Don't know if this works, but I know my cat hates the smell.
customer_reviews.author: Mai Lan Nguyen

customer_reviews.title: Poor consistency
customer_reviews.text: Maybe it has to do with the way it was stored but this was almost like water. It made it near impossible to put it on my cat’s paw. And as it sat upright on the shelf, it leaked out even though the cap was screwed on tight. I threw it out and I’m going to my local pet store for a new product.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: Easily 50% less yaking.
customer_reviews.text: I mash a little fingerfull on each cat's nose a couple times a week. Yes, they *could* just lick it off my finger, but the stuff is way gooey, like molasses, and it takes a while for kitty to lick it. Hence, the smear-it-on-the-nose technique my vet showed me. All 5 of mine love the stuff. Even the picky eaters who don't always like treats!
customer_reviews.author: Mary Wood

customer_reviews.title: From the looks of it, Yerm!
customer_reviews.text: I personally don't care for the flavor, but apparently my cat thinks it's the best thing since her own butt (see, because she's licking it all the time). Anyway, it squeezes out like caramel (the gel), so it's simple to add it to her wet food. It's more like an accent to her food at this point, but we haven't seen any hairballs since, so, yeah, thanks!
customer_reviews.author: PepperJay

customer_reviews.title: 2 paws up!
customer_reviews.text: My baby's favorite!! I've tried other brands & other flavors and this is his favorite! He demands his treats every night. That said we have another cat who is a bit (all right, a lot) grumpy and he won't touch this stuff. He wouldn't touch any of the other similar products either so it's not the product but just beware it might not be for all cats. I believe this really works too because both of our cats have long hair and the grumpy one is always getting hairballs while the one that likes this stuff & gets it daily, rarely has a hair ball - I mean like once every 3-4 months. They eat the exact same food too.
customer_reviews.author: Detroit Chick

customer_reviews.title: No more hacking.
customer_reviews.text: This product is GREAT for my cat. She loves the flavor!! I've been giving this to her for about a month now, and within that time frame I have yet heard her yack.
customer_reviews.author: Rob Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Cats aren't fond of it
customer_reviews.text: Only one of three of my kitties will get near the stuff. It's quite a thick paste, so if I try to put it on the paws of the other two who won't lick this straight from the container they just flick it off. Trying these kinds of products with pets is usually trial and error so I won't say the product is terrible just because my cats didn't like it. The color is off putting - it resembles ear wax. :/ Either way I can't really tell how effective it is because the one that will eat this doesn't struggle with hairballs anyway.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie

customer_reviews.title: don't let you can't get all choked up
customer_reviews.text: This product becomes highly recommended from my veterinarian. I have tried all sorts of hairball remedy is this seems to work the bests and my cat seems to love it . It is competitively priced's, came in a timely fashion, one of the biggest reasons why I ordered it on Amazon is I can never find it in the stores even though they carry it
customer_reviews.author: Pinhead954

customer_reviews.title: No more fur balls!
customer_reviews.text: My cat will actually lick this off of my finger. It seemed she was throwing up more and more and this has stopped that completely. Sometimes I mix it in with her food and other times, I put it on her paws or nose. I will purchase again and again.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Great for Ferrets!
customer_reviews.text: My furkids absolutely love this stuff! I use a syringe (without needle) to measure out about 1mL to feed each of my fuzzbutts at a time, and they lap it up with gusto. We've been using it for a few days and there are no adverse effects. We'll keep it up to keep everything moving through their system in an orderly fashion. Will definitely purchase again!
customer_reviews.author: KellyTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: It's GOOP TIME!  YUMMY GOOP TIME!
customer_reviews.text: Mr. Shenanigans luvs luvs luvs his GOOP! Goopity goop works every time and keeps his pipes clean! Yum yum goop - big sloppy goopy tube of goopity goodness! Yum! Makes going potty EASY and BREEZY! Get some!
customer_reviews.author: Magick Tech

customer_reviews.title: Hurray for fewer hairballs
customer_reviews.text: I previously purchased this product through my vet, but it has skyrocketed in price recently. This hairball remedy greatly helps my kitties keep their throats and bellies clear of hairballs, which makes me happy. They don't love having me chase them around, but I put it on their nose and mouth for them to lick clean. I will continue to purchase this product on amazon as long as other suppliers charge 3-5 times as much for it.
customer_reviews.author: J. Hodges

customer_reviews.title: Cat hates it, although vet-recommended
customer_reviews.text: My vet sells only the Tuna flavor, and it's a lot more expensive there. So knowing she loves catnip, I ordered this flavor. She hates it, I have to stick on her paw so she licks it off. Vet recommended 3 times a week due to my cat recently having emergency hairball removal surgery ($6000!). At least they come out, but she vomits them up instead of the hairball going out the other way.
customer_reviews.author: Nacho Libra

customer_reviews.title: You might need to trick your cat into using this
customer_reviews.text: My cats are old and set in their ways. I tried several ways to get them to take this as is, but they wouldn't have it. I tried mixing it into their favorite canned food, which they don't get on a regular basis. That did the trick. I have tried using other hairball products using the same method, but they wouldn't eat it, even when I mixed it into the canned food. The stuff works, and they'll take it better than any others I've tried.
customer_reviews.author: Shelly B

customer_reviews.title: At a loss with my cat.
customer_reviews.text: I cannot write a good review. My can will not eat it. She will not eat envy of the gels. I hoped that this one being fishy she will like, but no such luck. She likes only dry food. Don’t know what to do.
customer_reviews.author: Ukrainka

customer_reviews.title: This solution really works!
customer_reviews.text: I have a fastidious cleaner (wish she would do my house work as well as her self-cleaning). Because of her constant cleaning she would yak hairballs, a lot. I tried many products and foods that didn't change a thing. However, this stuff works! I was so surprised and happy that I no longer have to clean up cat yak (before the dog gets to it, I know, right). Just a little bit on a paw 2-3 times a week and no more racing the dog to the yak. She has completely stopped even though she still cleans herself a lot.
customer_reviews.author: Kat

customer_reviews.title: The cat says YUM!!
customer_reviews.text: The cat absolutely loves this stuff! While he'll eat the other flavors, this malt flavored one is his favorite. When he finishes what he's given, he looks up at me like he expects me to get more of this yummy treat for him! I know this is not the case with all cats, because my last cat wanted nothing to do with this or any other flavor. And if you would smear it on his foot for him to clean off like is suggested sometimes, he'd shake his foot until he could fling the gel off his foot! And people say cats have no personality!
customer_reviews.author: Angie_stl

customer_reviews.title: No Go
customer_reviews.text: My cat, who loves catnip, and likes other laxatone products, literally runs from this flavor. It certainly doesn't smell like catnip to me, and apparently my cat agrees. Maybe other cats will like it, but mine says no.
customer_reviews.author: ShopCat

customer_reviews.title: My cat didn't seem to like it much at first
customer_reviews.text: My cat didn't seem to like it much at first, but I've had to change the location where he gets it to a room I'm not often in. Otherwise, he pitched a fit whenever I was near it. The instructions say not to give it every day but I have given in to his demands and he gets a dose every night at 10 PM. He nearly went nuts for about 70 minutes when we put the clocks back an hour and it took him a week to adjust. I believe it helps with dry stool as well as hairballs. He loves it more than any food, catnip, grass or treat.
customer_reviews.author: Mimi

customer_reviews.title: Hard to work with; I prefer the Hartz formula
customer_reviews.text: This formula is stickier than the Hartz formula. Maybe that means it's better, but all I know is it's annoying to work with. It's stringy and hard to squirt out in a clean dollop (I add it to the top of my cat's soft food EOD), so the top of the tube and the cap get all gunky and sticky over time. It seemed to work fine as far as hairball prevention goes, but the Hartz brand is MUCH easier to work with, and is what I will be purchasing from this point forward (plus you can buy the Hartz formula in bulk!)
customer_reviews.author: Bangarang10

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Cat was struggling to cough up gross hairballs. You all know that god awful noise they make that gives you the willys? That noise like alot. I got this and put it on her paw and her fur looks better and she has stopped snarfing. She has gotten hip to it so she tries to pull her paw away but sneak attack gets her everytime.
customer_reviews.author: M.G.

customer_reviews.title: Finally a hairball remedy my cat likes!
customer_reviews.text: I have a cat who isn't picky about anything except for hairball laxatives. He HATES them. He'll eat anything else in the world, but not hairball laxatives. It's incredibly frustrating especially because he frequently needs it. I'm happy to report that I have finally found a hairball remedy he'll actually willingly eat! He licked it right from the tube, I didn't even have to smear it on his paw. And, at least for his last episode, just one dose did the trick! Will definitely be ordering this again.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't stick to cat fur
customer_reviews.text: No matter how much I try to rub this into my cat's paws, he just flicks it across the room with ease. So now I have puked of this crap in addition to piles of hairball throw up. Awesome.
customer_reviews.author: teejay

customer_reviews.title: Kitty approved! Results yet to be seen...
customer_reviews.text: My 16 year old cat has always struggled with hairballs. She definitely likes this flavor - but I’m not sure I’m seeing much of a difference in her hairball production just yet. She’s been on this stuff on and off for years so I think it helps some but she still has hairballs that come up. Was hoping it would get rid of them entirely.
customer_reviews.author: Sera

customer_reviews.title: My cat didn't like the taste
customer_reviews.text: I had been using a different product and thought I'd try this one. However, my cat didn't like the change so I had to mix it with a more familiar brand (wasn't available when needed).
customer_reviews.author: Dancingcat

customer_reviews.title: Must taste awful
customer_reviews.text: From all of the reviews saying that their cats loved the taste of this, that wasn’t my experience. Neither of my two cats, who are NOT picky eaters, refused to eat this stuff. I have to hold them down, pry open their mouths and shove it in. I do not recommend this stuff, just to difficult to use.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle M.A.

customer_reviews.title: Cats love it!
customer_reviews.text: Our cats love the flavoring and it can actually look like a 3 ring circus trying to get the Laxatone out of the tube fast enough for them! They even can detect the subtle sound of the lid opening and me dosing it out for them- running and clamoring to get to that stuff. I try and use once every 2 weeks or whenever I hear a cat trying to rid themselves of a hairball. Number of hairballs experienced by kitties is vastly reduced! (Of course, my current cats will eat lint off the floor. Previous kitties have been less voracious eaters, but still fond of the flavors.
customer_reviews.author: Sara Lynn Watson Brown

customer_reviews.title: NO HAIR BALLS...and Kitty loves it
customer_reviews.text: A vet told me about this product, to prevent hairballs in my new kitty (she had them bad!). It works so well, and my cat's life seems to revolve around 5pm daily when I let her lick off her dose of it right out of the top of the tube...smacking kitty lips and all. So cute, and not a hairball in sight since 1 week after her first dose!
customer_reviews.author: addictedtoreading

product_meta.title: TOMLYN Laxatone Hairball Remedy Gel for Cats
feature_bullets: Lubricates ingested hair, allowing it to move through the digestive tract and pass in the cat’s stool
Gentle hairball remedy for cats: Tomlyn Laxatone oral gel helps eliminate and prevent cat furballs
Laxatone cat hairball treatment is available in a range of tasty flavors to suit your cat’s tastes
Palatable, easy-to-administer oral gel; simply place on your cat’s nose or paws to stimulate licking
Hairball gel contains vet-formulated lubricants including soybean oil; Omega -3, -6, and -9 Fatty Acids

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
